# Simple Ocaml C Compiler without header
![Ocaml](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

## Mustafa Zaki Assagaf | Nicholas Sidharta

## Table of Contents

- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Features](#features)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [License](#license)

## Introduction

This is a simple C compiler written in Ocaml. It is a part of the final project of Functional Programming course. The compiler consists of mainly 3 parts: lexer, parser, and code generator. The lexer will generate a list of tokens from the input file. The parser will generate an abstract syntax tree from the list of tokens. The code generator will generate a C code from the abstract syntax tree.

The program is built by TDD (Test Driven Development) method. For this project the scope of the issue will be limited to the following C program:
```c
int main() {
  int x = 1;
  int y = 2;

  printf("(x + y) =%d\n", (x + y));

  return 0;
}
```

## Features

The working feature is limited to the parser. The parser will generate an abstract syntax tree from the list of tokens. The abstract syntax tree will be printed in the terminal. There is an available eval.ml file but it is not working yet.

## Installation
1. Clone this repository
2. Change directory to the repository
3. Assure that you have ocaml installed in your machine
4. Run the program
```bash
dune exec magic
```
5. (Optionally) if there is an error for missing packages, install the missing packages using opam before re-running the program
```bash
opam install <package_name>
```

## Contributions
So far this program is made while doing syncronized pair programming using vscode live share, thus the contributions for both members are equal.
